posts.post_content:
Looking for any period-correct examples of the below Hall of Famers. Low Grade/Beater condition ONLY. Does not have to be mainstream sets, either (Postcards obviously for the non-19th Century guys in this thread; i.e. Scrapps Tobacco for 19th Century example). Feel free to email me - [url]kmayusa6060@gmail.com[/url]

19th Century
Cap Anson
Charles Comiskey
Buck Ewing
Charles Radbourn
Al Spalding (1874 Harper's Weekly Boston)
Dan Brouthers
Ed Delahanty
Hugh Duffy
King Kelly
Jim O'Rourke
Kid Nichols
Harry Wright
Billy Hamilton
John Clarkson

Pud Galvin
Mickey Welch
Sam Thompson
Roger Connor
Amos Russie

Hank O'Day
Deacon White

Ray Brown

1948-1979
Bill McGowan
Leon Day
Turkey Stearnes
Hilton Smith
Willard Brown

What's your basis for these era classifications? The guys you have in 1948-1979 are an umpire who retired in 1954 (Bill McGowan) and five Negro Leaguers (though technically Frank Grant played in the 19th century, before the Negro Leagues proper).

[quote name="trdcrdkid" post=2132764]What's your basis for these era classifications? The guys you have in 1948-1979 are an umpire who retired in 1954 (Bill McGowan) and five Negro Leaguers (though technically Frank Grant played in the 19th century, before the Negro Leagues proper).[/QUOTE]

From what I've gathered, those players have cards in the eras I have them listed under (some of them don't have any cards from their playing days, but have cards from when they're still alive, like Turkey Stearnes; counting that for now). Only reason I have them in this thread is the off chance they have a postcard I'm unaware of.

[quote name="KMayUSA6060" post=2132337]Looking for any period-correct examples of the below Hall of Famers. Low Grade/Beater condition ONLY. Does not have to be mainstream sets, either (Postcards obviously for the non-19th Century guys in this thread; i.e. Scrapps Tobacco for 19th Century example). Thank you! 74 Hall of Famers left. Lifetime to accomplish it, but love shaking the trees every once in a while.
